intro: Coleosanthus riddellii, commonly known as the Riddell's spikeflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Pacific islands. It belongs to the family Alismataceae and is characterized by its unique, spike-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in wet, coastal environments and has lance-shaped leaves that are often submerged or floating. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in dense clusters, and it is adapted to brackish or saltwater conditions. Coleosanthus riddellii plays an important role in its native ecosystems, supporting various aquatic and terrestrial wildlife.
